bib_record.title: Potential interaction and transfer in elastic Li7(Li6,Li6)Li7 and inelastic Li7(Li6,Li6)Li7(0.48) scattering at E(lab)=9-40 MeV

free_txt: Optical model.
* From Prof.H.Freiesleben: The data files are no
longer accessible. 2016/07/29.
The Koeln 10 MV VDGT provides Li-6 beams of
40-50 Na. The 4 MV Dynamitron-tandem accelerator at
Ruhr provides Li-6 beam of 20-40 nA.
Li-6(Li-6,el) reaction at E(lab)=5-40 MeV.
- details
of experiment an data for Li-7(Li-7,el) and
Li-7(Li-7,inl) reactions
By CAJAD.
One pair of PSDs was utilized with the
defining detector (100-mum,8 x 47 mm**2) placed at
21.5, 33.5, 45.5 degr.  The open PSD with the same
size was placed at 94.5, 93.5 and 92.5 degr.
The uncertainty in target thickness is 9.5%.
The error in beam current integration is 4%.
The error in the effective charge state of the
integrated beam is 3%.
Uncertainties in determining the yield for
elastic scattering is 5%.
The overall uncertainty for the
elastic scattering: for the smallest angles of 15.5%
An additional angle dependent uncertainty due to the
uncertainty of the efficiency correction for angles
less or equal 25 degree. This influences the slope of
the angular distributions in this angle range and leads
to following uncertainties.
* Statistical uncertainties are less than the
symbol size.
The 4-MV Dynamitron tandem accelerator
at energy range 9-16 MeV.
A metallic Li target(natural
lithium-92.5% Li-7 and 7.5% Li-6) was evaporated onto a
thin carbon backing of about 10-mug/cm**2. The target
thickness of 13.5-mug/cm**2 for Li-7 was determined by
means of detection of backscattered Li-7 recoil nuclei
from scattering Cu-63 off the Li target.
fig 2 from NP/A,629,656,1998
Two pair of position sensitive surface barrier
detectors(PSDs) were used, each pair consist of a solid
angle defining PSD(500 mum, 8*15 mm**2) and an open
PSD(100-mum, 8*47-mm**2)-for first experiment at the
energy 20-40 MeV (Koeln University).
For second experiment (Ruhr-University Bochum) one pair
of PSDs was utilized with the defining detector
The uncertainty in target thickness is 9.5%.
The error in beam current integration is 4%.
The error in the effective charge state of the
integrated beam is 3%.
Uncertainties in determining the yield for
inelastic scattering is 10%.
The overall uncertainty for the
elastic scattering: for the smallest angles of 17.8%
An additional angle dependent uncertainty due to the
uncertainty of the efficiency correction for angles
less or equal 25 degree. This influences the slope of
the angular distributions in this angle range and leads
to uncertainties.
* Statistical uncertainties are less than the

differential cross sections are included in all figures

The 10 MV Van de Graaff tandem
at energies between 20-40 MeV.
A metallic Li target(40-mug/cm**2 of Li-6 plus 22.5-
mug/cm**2 of Li-7) was evaporated onto a thin  carbon
backing of about 20-mug/cm**2.
